I am not going to take any PoW attack on Bitcoin seriously until it happens to Ethereum. Here's why:  1. Attacking Ethereum is something like 60% cheaper 2. DeFi lets you leverage up a double-spend risklessly 3. More routes to monetization via tx ordering manipulation

The Ethereum 2.0 Phase 0 Beacon Chain in 1 tweet:  *New chain that shards connect & talk to *Become a validator by depositing 32 ETH into the beacon chain  Two Main Node Types: *Beacon nodes (similar to miners, heavy on resources) *Validator clients (lightweight, build blocks)

Some FUD debunking: Saying Infura is a single point failure for Ethereum is like saying AOL dial-up services were a single point failure for the internet in the 1990s. AOL didn't control the internet, and competition quickly emerged to provide consumers many ways to access it.
